video.name: TOFU 65 – VEGAN PANEER 65 | Vegan Richa recipes
video.description:
Tofu Paneer 65 is a spicy, sweet, savory Indian entree with influence from chinese flavors. Serve it with rice or as is. Vegan Nut-free Recipe
FULL RECIPE: https://www.veganricha.com/2019/09/tofu-65-vegan-paneer-65.html
INDIAN KITCHEN:  https://veganricha.com/vegan-richas-indian-kitchen-cookbook
EVERYDAY KITCHEN: https://veganricha.com/vegan-richas-everyday-kitchen

Don’t ask me why this dish is called tofu 65. There are several theories on why the sauce combination, initially used with chikin was called chicken 65. From there vegetarian versions picked up the flavors for paneer 65 and cauliflower 65 (Gobi 65 is in Indian Kitchen book).

The flavors have influence from Chinese sweet and sour profile and southern Indian flavors for this delectable thick sauce that is spicy, savory, sweet, with hints of flavors from curry leaves and chilies. It all works! You have to try it #trustindianflavors ! You can find curry leaves in Indian stores or online on amazon, or just omit. 

Tofu is battered in a spiced curry leaf and soy sauce batter, then baked. The sauce has large slices of onion and bell pepper with ginger, garlic, soy sauce and sriracha. A bit of sweet to balance it out.

Don’t like Tofu? Use Cauliflower or soy curls! Lots of substitute options in the recipe notes.
Gluten-free Options in notes as well.

#veganricha #easyveganrecicpes #tofu65 #paneer65 #indianrecipes 
Music: Calling by Ikson

Follow: 
My blog: https://veganricha.com
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/VeganRicha
Instagram: https://instagram.com/veganricha
Twitter: https://www.twitter.com/veganricha
Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/veganricha

recipeIngredient: 3 tbsp all purpose flour (, use rice flour for gluten-free)
6  fresh or frozen curry Leaves (, chopped (see notes))
2 tsp soy sauce (, tamari for gluten-free)
1-2  hot green chilies (, such as serrano , sliced thin)
1 tbsp sriracha or sambal oelek or a mix of both ((use less for less heat))
1 tbsp soy sauce (, tamari for gluten-free)

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, add flour, cornstarch, curry leaves, paprika, cayenne, garlic, salt and ginger. Add lemon, soy sauce and water to make a thick batter.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, add flour, cornstarch, curry leaves, paprika, cayenne, garlic, salt and ginger. Add lemon, soy sauce and water to make a thick batter.

recipeInstructions.text: Add tofu and toss to coat. Spread on parchment lined baking sheet or dish, Spray oil, bake at 400 deg F (205 C) for 20 mins.
recipeInstructions.name: Add tofu and toss to coat. Spread on parchment lined baking sheet or dish, Spray oil, bake at 400 deg F (205 C) for 20 mins.

recipeInstructions.text: Sauce: Heat oil over medium heat in a large skillet. Add chilies and cook for a minute, then add curry leaves and garlic and cook for 1 minute or until just about translucent.
recipeInstructions.name: Sauce: Heat oil over medium heat in a large skillet. Add chilies and cook for a minute, then add curry leaves and garlic and cook for 1 minute or until just about translucent.

recipeInstructions.text: Add onion and bell pepper and cook until onion is golden on some edges. Add sauces, black pepper, salt and sugar and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Add onion and bell pepper and cook until onion is golden on some edges. Add sauces, black pepper, salt and sugar and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix cornstarch in 1/2 cup water. Add the water cornstarch slurry to the pan and bring to a boil to thicken.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix cornstarch in 1/2 cup water. Add the water cornstarch slurry to the pan and bring to a boil to thicken.

recipeInstructions.text: Fold in the baked tofu lightly and take off heat. Garnish with cilantro and serve over rice or grains.Store: Refrigerate the cooked tofu 65 for upto 3 days. Make ahead: You can bake the battered tofu ahead. The sauce tends to thickene on sotring, so make the sauce fresh and add baked tofu or baked veggies to serve.
recipeInstructions.name: Fold in the baked tofu lightly and take off heat. Garnish with cilantro and serve over rice or grains.Store: Refrigerate the cooked tofu 65 for upto 3 days. Make ahead: You can bake the battered tofu ahead. The sauce tends to thickene on sotring, so make the sauce fresh and add baked tofu or baked veggies to serve.
